title: A mistake in the 'Legend of the Poro King' info?
body: 'Your Legend' on the League of Legends website says 'enlisting the help of the Poro King... and turning the tide for **his** team. I wasn't sure if the 'he' was referring to the Poro King, or if the writers were referring to me as a 'he;' assuming that 100% of the League of Legends community is male. I don't think Riot should be using these pronouns as they are obviously incorrect for a lot of people including me; and even if it was referring to the Poro King I think it could have been worded better to avoid confusion such as this. Thoughts?

replies.body: DiddlyDonger, have you checked it recently? i feel they have changed the pronoun. because i remembered it as you said. but now it seems to be "[summoner] and their team."

Actually I did check it again and it looks like it's been changed.

"Their legend grows with every victory, DiddlyDonger, a true Champion of the Poros, DiddlyDonger tagged their enemies with 266 poros, enlisting the help of the Poro King 100 times and turning the tide for their team." 

Also, my friend sent a support ticket to Riot and this was the reply;

> Hi there Summoner,
> 
> Sorry if it seems like you were offended with the pronoun that was used in the page were you and your achievement were recognize. Please do let me explain as to why we used "his".
> 
> First off, "his" is generally the pronoun to any noun if the gender of the person being acknowledge is unknown. We are totally sorry if this gave you any inconvenience but if you have anything else to ask, please do let me know.
> 
> Winter Miming
> Player Support Specialist
> Riot Games

So the 'he' used in the previous message was in fact directed at the player as I assumed. I guess the people in the thread who disagreed with me were wrong.

hah, haters gon' hate hey. i am glad you figured it out. we need to embrace female players. i play with my wife and after a bad game an enemy asked "what are you a bunch of girls trying to play?" and i was like, so what if we are?
Yeah it's such a shame that so much sexism exists in the gaming world. I've met some of the nicest people here on League of Legends but there are always a few douche bags that come along.
so many. league is a great place to find an argument usually. i have taken to calling it either MSN2014 or 4CHAN2014. haha.
There is no confusion there at all, the Poro King fights for his team, the team that summons him.

i think there is much ambiguity, but i also think they updated it since.

"Kajata fought their way across the bridge in Snowdown Style, slinging poros alongside allies and working together to summon the help of the Poro King himself.

Their legend grows with every victory, Kajata, a true Friend of the Poros, Kajata tagged their enemies with 128 poros, enlisting the help of the Poro King 41 times and turning the tide for their team."

"their team."
i think OP is correct, i assumed the "he" in question was me, i would be %%%%ty if i was a girl. no idea why you were downvoted so much. i upped it.
ahhh no, but that wasn't really the point of this thread.
I see the ambiguity too. I would assume that it refer's to the Poro King, but it is gonna annoy some people who interpret it as the player.
From reading what you said, sounds like the he is for Poro King. If Riot was referring to "you", they'd put "your team".
